formation_devops.infrastructure.files module

This module provides convenient function to load and save from the application’s data/ folder (as defined in the config).

class FileManager(root: str)[source]

Bases: object

Utility class to handle data files contained in a root folder

Parameters

root (str) – absolute path to the root data folder

>>> files = FileManager('/path/to/data/')
>>> df = files.load('raw/iris.csv')
# Loads dataframe from /path/to/data/raw/iris.csv
>>> files.save(df, 'clean/iris.pickle')
# saves to /path/to/data/clean/iris.pickle
# end ensures 'clean' folder exists
get_filepath(relative_path: str, create_folders: bool = False) → str[source]

Returns absolute path from relative to data/ folder

ensure_folder_exists(abspath: str) → None[source]

creates subfolders if necessary

save(thing, relative_path: str, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]

Save object (usually dataframe) to file

Additional *args and **kwargs are passed to the underlying function.

>>> df = pd.DataFrame()
>>> files.save(df, 'clean/iris.pickle')
load(relative_path: str, *args, **kwargs) → Optional[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame][source]

Loads .pickle and .csv from file relative to data/ folder

Parameters

  • relative_path (str) – path relative to the application data/ folder

  • args – those are passed to the inner load functionxz

  • kwargs – those are passed to the inner load function

>>> # this loads the file /path/to/data/raw/iris.csv
>>> df = files.load('raw/iris.csv', nrows=10, dtype='str')
